g.text: Department of Materials Science and Engineering, Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, 607 Taylor Road, Piscataway, New
Lumenari, Inc., 1501 Bull Lea Road, Suite 105, Lexington, Kentucky 40511, United States
Emerging phototherapy in a clinic and plant photomorphogenesis call for
eﬃcient red/far-red light resources to target and/or actuate the interaction of light and living
organisms. Rare-earth-doped phosphors are generally promising candidates for eﬃcient light-
emitting diodes but still bear lower quantum yield for the far-red components, potential
supply risks, and high-cost issues. Thus, the design and preparation of eﬃcient non-rare-earth
activated phosphors becomes extremely important and arouses great interest. Fabrication of
phosphors signiﬁcantly promotes the potential applications by eﬃciently
converting blue excitation light of a commercial InGaN chip to far-red broadband emission in
850 nm region. The action response of phototherapy (
760 nm) are well overlapped. Based on the
temperature-dependent steady luminescence and time-resolved spectroscopies, energy
transfer models are rationally established by means of the conﬁgurational coordinate
ions. An optimal sample of Na
5%. Additionally, an InGaN LED device encapsulated by using Na
phosphor was fabricated. The current exploration will pave a promising way to engineer non-rare-earth activated
optoelectronic devices for all kinds of photobiological applications.
Plant cultivation in horticulture, as well as phototherapy to
treat physical illness, has been signiﬁcantly stimulated by the
emergence of eﬃcient red and far-red light-emitting diodes
For plant growth, photosynthesis requires red light
690 nm range to overlap well with the
light-mediated seed germination, seedling development, and
photoperiodism, which is critical to healthy plant development.
On the other hand, for phototherapy, there exist several active
response bands located in the red and far-red light regions: (i)
growing body of evidence indicates photoacceptors in cells,
oxidase and the terminal enzyme of
mitochondrial electron transport chain, exhibit response to
low-intensity red light and even near-infrared light.
to 670 or 726 nm LEDs red light was reported to decrease the
healing time in chronic ischemic ulcers in rats.
achievement of novel red/far-red sources would signiﬁcantly
promote the development of plant cultivation and photo-
been emerging as indispensable solid state light sources
because of their unique merits such as energy savings,
However, the deﬁciency of far-red light
components limits LEDs applications in natural light sources,
plant cultivation, phototherapy, and so on.

are limited by the following features: (i) Eu
ions feature intra-4f parity-forbidden electronic transitions
which have relatively weak absorption and therefore a low

than the intra-4f parity-forbidden transitions, but nearly all

and hence non-RE activated phosphors become extremely
important and currently arouse great interest.
